intro: Cacalia poeppigiana, commonly known as the blueweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Cacalia poeppigiana is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
